item.Name: is tracker unequipped upon successful scan
is ping continuously generating data on original strongest signal over duration

_field_tag_reference_64.name: weapon#The weapon provides hooks for much of the UI and animation

_field_real.name: ping max distance:wu#The max distance the volume could be from the player's point of view

_field_angle.name: ping max view pitch angle:degrees [0, 180]#The max pitch angle the volume could be from the player's point of view
ping max view yaw angle:degrees [0, 180]#The max yaw angle the volume could be from the player's point of view
ping signal view angle:degrees [0, ping max view angle]#The max angle that is rendered in the graph, outside of renders at the farthest side

_field_real.name: ping signal duration:seconds#The number of seconds the pinged object should emit a signal

plugin._field_explanation: Determines how the signal strength attenuates over the ping signal duration.
Maps actual distance weight to a modified distance weight so we can have greater control over strength contrast at close range.

_field_real_fraction.name: ping signal angle weight:[0,1]#Honing weight given to the angle towards to the tracking area

_field_explanation.name: angle weight over distance weight function

plugin._field_explanation: Determines pct of the angle weight that can be applied over % of distance weight. This is used to avoid ugly jumps from no signal to big-ish signal when you move in/out of range of signal looking directly at it.

_field_struct.name: angle weight over distance weight function

_field_real_bounds.name: ping signal low rumble range:[0,1]#Frequency range for a signal's low rumble
ping signal high rumble range:[0,1]#Frequency range for a signal's high rumble
ping signal trigger rumble range:[0,1]#Frequency range for a signal's trigger rumble

plugin._field_explanation: Use this curve to define the shape of rumble intensity over ping signal duration.
Use this curve to define the trigger rumble strength as it approaches center. Consider 0.5 center intensity value, [0,0.5] is not my side & [0.5,1.0] is my side

_field_tag_reference_64.name: tracking area near ENTER effect#Triggered when player ENTERS tracking area near range. Plays on the player.
tracking area near EXIT effect#Triggered when player EXITS tracking area near range. Plays on the player.
ping success effect#Triggered when player successfully pings something. Plays at trackable object's location for duration of ping success.
scan complete effect#Triggered when player successfully scans a tracking object. Plays on the player.
scan fail effect#Triggered when player fails to scans a tracking object. Plays on the player.
scan loop effect#Triggered when player is scanning a tracking object. Plays on the player.

_field_long_integer.name: number of data columns#number of data columns, must be at least 1 and rows x columns must be less than 10,000
number of data rows#number of data rows, must be at least 1 and rows x columns must be less than 10,000

_field_real.name: depth#the depth of the plane of the signal (regardless of data point size or number)
height#the height of the plane of the signal, noise and signal values are calculated against this (regardless of data point size or number)
width#the width of the plane of the signal (regardless of data point size or number)
data point size#the size of the data point texture

_field_real_point_3d.name: wave offset#offset of the wave from the marker x+ right, y+ up, z+ forward

_field_real_bounds.name: amplitude percentage#Affects the min/max height of ping success peaks in the signal

_field_real.name: domain half size#defines the domain of the normal distribution: [-size, +size]

plugin._field_explanation: effects the "pointiness" of the signal. The low value will be used when really close to the object and you want a spike in the wave form. The high value will be used when far from the object and you want a shallower wave form. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution

_field_real_bounds.name: sigma effects the "pointyness" of the signal:

_field_fraction_bounds.name: z axis-min-max percentage#the min max depth the signal will effect the plane (Can be ignored in the shader)

_field_long_integer.name: number of data columns#number of data columns, must be at least 1 and rows x columns must be less than 10,000
number of data rows#number of data rows, must be at least 1 and rows x columns must be less than 10,000

_field_real.name: depth#the depth of the plane of the signal (regardless of data point size or number)
height#the height of the plane of the signal, noise and signal values are calculated against this (regardless of data point size or number)
width#the width of the plane of the signal (regardless of data point size or number)
data point size#the size of the data point texture

_field_real_point_3d.name: wave offset#offset of the wave from the marker x+ right, y+ up, z+ forward

_field_real.name: scanning hint amplitude#the distance the particles should move to provide a hint during the scan mode
scanning hint frequency#the frequency of the hint during the scan mode
the max initial scan particle velocity#the max initial particle velocity towards the hint target
noise duration enter#number of seconds over which to linearly scale up the noise after getting near enough to the signal
noise duration exit#number of seconds over which to linearly scale down the noise after getting far enough away from the signal
frequency modulation#Affects wave direction and distance between peaks

_field_real_bounds.name: amplitude modulation percentage (min to max)#Affects peak heights

_field_real.name: phase#Affects speed at which waves move across
frequency modulation#Affects wave direction and distance between peaks

_field_real_bounds.name: amplitude modulation percentage (min to max)#Affects peak heights

_field_real.name: phase#Affects speed at which waves move across
frequency modulation#Affects wave direction and distance between peaks

_field_real_bounds.name: amplitude modulation percentage (min to max)#Affects peak heights

_field_real.name: phase#Affects speed at which waves move across
frequency modulation#Affects wave direction and distance between peaks

_field_real_bounds.name: amplitude modulation percentage (min to max)#Affects peak heights

_field_real.name: phase#Affects speed at which waves move across
